alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Pine and west central Burnett Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 515 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Grantsburg, or 8 miles east of Pine City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Pine and west central Burnett Counties, including the following locations... Phantom Lake, Cloverdale, Saint Croix State Park and Chengwatana State Forest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters.
